inlineContent.text: I’m not good at knowing by limits. It isn’t until I’m a ways past them that I notice that I’m at capacity — that I’ve got no more time or energy to give. I realized this this past week as I tried to plan a birthday party along with everything else I had going on. I didn’t do a good job of it because I had no room left. Even the smallest things become difficult when I’m at that point.
I do believe that I need to be in this situation right now to help our company survive. But I need to figure out the warning signs in the future because this isn’t sustainable.

abstract.text: David Brunow, known as Brunow [ˈbɹunoʊ] to the folks he works with, is a human living on Earth. You might have something in common with him — if you think it is ridiculous that he is talking about himself in the first person here, so does he.
